content.description:
Another roped boulder problem.

Start up the low angle slab in the corner, stem out against the corner and clip your first bolt. From there, leave the corner and head up/left over the bulge/roof to the anchor. Sadly, there is high probability that you will grab very uncomfortable holds and dirty rock. 

Easy to walk off from the anchor.

Nearly directly across from the bottom of the east stairs. This climb is in the left facing corner, a few meters west of the base of the walk of trail.
2 bolts, 1 bolt anchor.

A 2 pitch climb that takes you to the top of the bluff.

P1: (~5.8, 8 bolts, 2 bolt anchor): Aim for the dihedral capped by a roof. You can belay from the dirt, or scramble up past the first 2 bolts (maybe 5.5) to the belay ledge and start from there. Either way, simple climbing- big holds, low angle, a couple of mini roofs to pull.

P2: (5.8, 8 bolts, 2 bolt anchor, crux pitch): From the P1: anchor go generally up until you reach a ledge, then head hard left before going up again. You'll be able to see the second bolt above the ledge before you go left, the first will come into view as you traverse over. Long draw the first 3 bolts on this pitch (2 below the ledge, 1 above the ledge), consider putting long draws on other bolts as well to straighten out the rope line. 

Do not link pitches, the rope drag is horrendous!

Getting Down: 
1. Walk off- head up a bit past the anchors (there's actually two sets of anchors) and trend climbers right (east) to link up with the well worn summit/walk-off trail. This will bring you down ~100 m east of the last dirt you stood on.
2. Rap- 2 single rope raps gets you to the ground. Both pitches are <30 m. You can also rap back to the belay ledge and tag the other couple of climbs that start there!

Look for the big roof of the climb next door to the left, from there, look up and to the right for the big corner (white rock down low, weathered grey rock up higher). The roof capped dihedral is also easy to spot, this line crosses very close to this feature. 
8 bolts, 2 bolt anchor with chains (each pitch)

First bolt is in the yellowish rock, the line goes up and traverses right a bit. Slightly awkward. 

From the belay ledge (see topo on the main page for this sector), there are 3 bolt lines. This is the middle bolt line. 
4 bolts, 2 bolt anchor (fat metolius rap hangers)

The crux is a slightly awkward move right off the deck (protected by the 1st bolt). The second bolt is in the cement grey rock. 

Anchors are shared with the route to the left.

Farthest right line on the belay ledge (see topo for sector). 
4 bolts, 2 bolt anchor (fat metolius rap hangers)

On the south face of the main bluff, this sector stretches from a small, bolted boulder problem next to the walk-off trail from the top (far east), to another bolted boulder problem on the western edge of the sector, with a few lower grade sport climbs between. This area gets sun nearly all day.
